stem: A partygoer awakens after sleeping with his arm over the back of a chair. He has wrist drop, decreased sensation over the dorsal first web space, but preserved strength in elbow extension. Where is the lesion most likely located?

choices.A: Radial nerve in the spiral groove
choices.B: Posterior cord of the brachial plexus

rationale_correct: Compression in the spiral groove causes wrist drop and dorsal hand numbness while sparing triceps function because branches to the long head leave proximally.

rationale_distractors.B: Posterior cord injury would cause more global deficits, including axillary nerve involvement.
rationale_distractors.C: Axillary compression affects triceps function leading to weak elbow extension.
rationale_distractors.D: Posterior interosseous lesions are motor only and spare sensation.
rationale_distractors.E: Deep branch entrapment within supinator yields posterior interosseous syndrome without sensory loss.
